name: Townhouse Siam Privi Hotel
detail: My girlfriend and I stayed for more than 4 week, because the price and value was the best on Agoda. + best price (450 THB) + big (35 sm) bright rooms + led TV + new comfortable mattresses + very friendly stuff + 15 minutes walk to MRT Hui Kwang + lots of cheep massage, services and food around + night market Hui Kwang has a lot of good fruits and vegetables for best price + no smoking rooms + quite place =============================== - no sightseeing - if you don't like to walk, you should take a taxi or bike everytime you go somewhere =============================== After all, one of the best hotels for such price, no doubt we will recommend it, and enjoy it on our next visit to Bangkok

name: Sunday Platinum Suites
detail: The room are super large with a little kitchen so nice.

name: Palette The Travellers Hotel Bangkok
detail: It was great experience to stay with the property.

name: Grand Howard Hotel
detail: My son (15), my two daughters (12 and 9) and me stayed at the Grand Howard Hotel for nine nights. It was our first stay in Asia (even our first stay outside of Europe). The staff of the Grand Howard Hotel was very welcoming. The hotelroom was big, clean and had all comfort you need. We had a corner room in the 17th floor and could enjoy a spectacular view of Bangkok because of the very big windows. My children especially enjoyed the big swimming pool in the 6th floor. Part of it is roofed (protected from the sun) so you can use it at all day times. But the most we loved the staff of the hotel. They gave us good advice about what to see in Bangkok and they gave us a warm welcome every time when we returned to the hotel. We felt like being home. Thanks a lot to the staff of the Grand Howard Hotel!

name: The Quarter Hualamphong by UHG
detail: The hotel is located in the city centre, accessible by both MRT, train, bus and taxi alike. It is only 5 minutes on foot from the famous Bangkok Train Station and MRT Hua Lampong Station. Situated on the 12th Floor, the hotel offers a panoramic view of Bangkok city centre and old town. Did we mention that the hotel is only 10 minutes walk from the Chinatown? Besides Chinatown there are other attractions nearby. The lobby is modern and spacious. The standard superior room we stayed was equally roomy, modern and clean. The hotel has done its best at upkeep the property but there were signs of aging in our bathroom wall and other furnitures. The bed, linen, blanket and pillow covers, and towel were clean. Other furnitures and amenities were well-appointed. The deal we got for superior room with breakfast was undeniable. The price we paid included breakfast. Normally, it would have been a buffet breakfast but on our particular visit there were only a few guests, so the hotel provided us with on-demand breakfast set. We can only say this hotel offers the best value for money we paid.

name: The Quarter Silom by UHG
detail: Me and my GF decided to change the hotels everyday while we were visiting Bangkok. After we came to the Quater Silom we stopped moving to the other places. Really great place with a perfect location and kind staff. Would come and stay here again! Thanks to the management and to everyone who make this place to be as it is! üôè

name: Mode Sathorn Hotel
detail: The staff are incredibly nice which makes this hotel a pleasant stay. The rooms are not as good as I thought they would be, already a bit dated which was surprising since most reviews said it was a new hotel. The breakfast was the most disappointing part, again weird because all the reviews said it was so great. The coffee in the restaurant really needs to change, it was actually horrid. Again, the staff was superb and worked so nice. I've stayed in most high end hotels in Bangkok and would say this one is mediocre in comparison; not good nor bad. The staff are the best part. Room service food could be improved, but it was really cheap so I can't complain. The view from the high floors is quite nice so that was a positive as well.

name: The Landmark Bangkok
detail: The property exceeded our expectations in every aspect.

name: Rambuttri Village Hotel
detail: My favorite hotel in Bangkok at economy prices. While this is not the cheapest hotel around Khao San rd it offers the best value for money and still quite inexpensive. It is very clean and comfortable and the staff performance has improved significantly with years. While it doesn't have it's own restourant, it is located inside a small village of shops and has all the conveniences at hand. Roof top pool is a nice touch.

name: The Quarter Ploenchit by UHG
detail: When I first enter the room, I found little pieces of food on the table, so I called the operator to ensure if my room has been cleaned before. I actually don‚Äôt mind removing them by myself but I was concerned about the hygiene due to Covid-19 situation. The operator said that she has no idea, she needed to ask the housekeeper. Then, another staff visited my room to pickup the pieces of food. He apologized and left. I asked if my room has been cleaned or not. He said it was an empty room and he has no idea about it. After I checked out and left for an airport. I found my ID card missing, so I called back to the hotel front. I told them that I do need the ID card to take a flight that morning and requested to have a housekeeper checking for the ID card in my room. The operator told me he will do so and call me back. It‚Äôs already another day. I‚Äôve been back home after a very difficult situation at the airport. I never get a call. Actually, the hotel is nice and fully facilitated. The room is kind of small but lovely and convenient. The location is good. The promo price is the best. All the staff treated and talked to me very politely. But, their service is obviously careless. I hope they mind this review and improve. Then, it would be very perfect.
